content.rendered:
Registration is now open for our October Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at the challenges arising from the Covid-19 pandemic and the consequences it has had for marine warranty surveys on current and future projects.

The webinar is scheduled for Thursday 15th October at 1100hrs UK.

Undoubtedly, the current pandemic has created challenges and obstacles to all surveying activities. In this webinar we will attempt to:

  • Explain the consequences of the Covid-19 pandemic on the project cargo sector
  • Review the steps being taken during the current Covid-19 restrictions to provide risk mitigation measures during the shipment of project cargo. This will include a case study
  • Review the amended survey warranty wording recently introduced by the Joint Cargo Committee to address the current Covid-19 pandemic and any future pandemics

Long-standing Naval Architect and Marine Engineer Surveyor John Pope, based in the UK, will present the technical subject.

The session chairman will be Pat Cannie, Group MD of Marine in the Middle East & India, and the month’s casualty reports will be presented by surveyor Fena Boyle from our London office.

If you wish to attend this webinar, click here to register.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: August Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register now for our August Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be discussing the current status of the Salvage Market and new developments in this sector.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: September Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register now for our September Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be detailing first-hand experiences of our findings during ‘Shipshape©’ Risk Assessment Surveys.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar - July Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register for our July Market Briefing for the maritime and maritime insurance sectors, our experts will be presenting on shiprepair & shipbuilding in Turkey, specifically the development of the shipyards in the Tuzla and Yalova area.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: December Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Registration is now open for our December Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at semi-submersible and heavy lift ships, focusing on design features, uses and risk factors.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Marine Casualty Market Briefing Webinar - Vessel Lay-up and Reactivation
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Join AqualisBraemar Marine experts for our Market Briefing webinar at 3:30pm GMT on Thursday 9th April 2020.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports impressive WWII restoration project
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar was recently engaged by National Museum Royal Navy to act as marine warranty supervisor for the trailered loadout of the tank carrying landing craft (LCT) from ShipHall B inside Portsmouth Naval Dockyard to the D-Day Museum in Southsea, UK, where the LCT will be exhibited to the public.
